title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Thursday, 19 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: a man had been found guilty at southwark crown court of murdering his partner .
a serious shortage of teachers is forcing schools across cambridgeshire to operate without enough staff .
peterborough united fans are launching a fundraising campaign to create a statue for club legend chris turner .

documents.title: that 's it from cambridgeshire live
text: the team at cambridgeshire live are signing off now .

we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates for the county , leading with news cambridgeshire police have set up a dedicated operation in response to the paris attacks .
you can send us your stories , and comments any time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: cambridge folk festival announces new young person discounts
text: cambridge folk festival has announced a range of discounts for younger people for next year 's event with the aim of `` attracting young audiences '' when tickets go on sale on 1 december .
the festival at cherry hinton hall , takes place between 28 and 31 july 2016 .
it attracts some of the greatest performers from around the word , but the line-up wo n't be announced until spring 2016 .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: it 's flu vaccination time
text: this is child 's play
what you can see is the nhs choices flu film being promoted by the cambridgeshire and peterborough clinical commissioning group .
the film reminds people to get a flu vaccination this season .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : a man is guilty of murder after a woman 's torso was discovered in peterborough launch night for chris turner statue fundraising appeal
text: the headlines for cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : mostly dry overnight
text: it will be mostly dry for much of cambridgeshire , but there may be an isolated shower .
but people should expect a mostly dry day tomorrow , with sunny spells and highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .

documents.title: have your say on next year 's budget for peterborough
text: a reminder has been sent out via twitter to people in peterborough to have their say about next year 's budget .
peterborough city council has just announced it needs to save £ 12m next year , but says there will be no cuts to services .
the first phase of the budget proposals for 2016/17 is out and we now want to hear your views : full info here :
@ twitterid i gave my views last time and was totally ignored so i sha n't bother again but thanks for asking .
# wasteoftime
@ twitterid anyone can put off debt repayment exactly opposite of # conservatives # austerity prog .
aims .
piling up debt for our children
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cambridge united sign two players on loan
text: new cambridge united manager shaun derry has made his first foray into the transfer market .
striker ben williamson , 26 , has joined from gillingham , while terry kennedy , 22 , arrives from sheffield united .
both players have agreed loan deals until 3 january .
only midfielder keith keane ( groin ) is definitely ruled out of saturday 's match against accrington in league two , though harrison dunk is struggling with a back problem .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: peterborough suitcase torso murder : jokubauskas guilty of murder
text: just an hour ago , we brought you the news that vytautas jokubauskas has been convicted of his partner 's murder .
ramute butkiene 's torso was discovered in a suitcase in mayor 's walk , peterborough in june :

documents.title: peterborough torso murderer dispersed victim 's body
text: a man convicted of murdering ramute butkiene dismembered her body and buried her arms and legs in woods near their peterborough home .
the mother 's torso was discovered in a suitcase in a house in mayor 's walk in june , after officers were called to the property by sus tenants .
jokubauskas was convicted of his partner 's murder earlier today and has been given a life sentence .

documents.title: i was a 'naughty little kid ' at school , says louis smith
text: louise smith has been talking this afternoon about how he was a `` naughty little kid '' at school .
the peterborough based olympic medalist was at the opening of the willow centre at the sawtry village academy .
it 's been set up to help students who struggle in mainstream schools .
he says he recognises himself in some of the issues the pupils are dealing with .
louis says gymnastics gave him a target
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: peterborough torso murder : 'gruesome crime ' say police
text: det insp pushpa guild says officers hope `` knowing jokubauskas will spend many years behind bars brings some peace to ramute butkiene 's loved ones '' .
the 42-year-old 's remains were found in a suitcase in a house in peterborough in what officers described as `` a gruesome crime against an innocent woman '' .
bytautas jokubauskas received a life sentence today for her murder , and will serve a minimum of 25 years .

documents.title: life sentence for peterborough man in torso in suitcase murder
text: a man convicted of murdering his partner , ramute butkiene , has been sentenced to life .
ms butkiene 's torso was discovered in a suitcase in mayor 's walk in peterborough in june .
vytautas jokubauskas , 57 , has been told he 'll serve a minimum of 25 years .

documents.title: torso in suitcase murder : ramute butkiene 'badly beaten '
text: a woman whose torso was found in a suitcase in peterborough was beaten so badly before she died she looked like a `` rotten apple , '' southwark crown court heard .
vytautas jokubauskas has today been found guilty of ramute butkiene 's murder .
the 57-year-old hid her remains in a suitcase after he killed her .

documents.title: guilty verdict for peterborough man who killed his partner
text: a jury has unanimously found vytautas jokubauskas guilty of the murder of his girlfriend ramute butkiene .
ms butkiene torso was discovered at a property in mayor 's walk in june this year .
officers were called to the property following reports of a suspected body in a suitcase after tenants noticed an unpleasant smell coming from a locked room rented by jokubauskas .

documents.title: peterborough man found guilty of murder
text: a man has been convicted of murdering his partner .
vytautas jokubauskas was found guilty by a unanimous jury at southwark crown court of the murder of 42-year-old ramute butkiene .
ms ramute 's torso was discovered at a property in mayor 's walk on 5 june .

documents.title: breakingjokubauskas guilty of murdering partner
text: it 's just been announced vytautas jokubauskas has been found guilty of murdering his partner ramute butkiene in peterborough .
the jury returned the verdict this afternoon .

documents.title: gymnast louis smith opens new school facility
text: the olympic medallist louis smith has opened the sawtry village academy alternative provision unit .
he cut the ribbon this afternoon at the facility for students who struggle to cope in mainstream school for emotional , social , behavioural and medical reasons .
the centre , known as the willow , currently helps seven students with some of them studying for their gcses .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: violent attacks on paramedics in our county on the rise
text: the number of violent attacks on ambulance staff in our region is on the rise , new figures released today show .
violent attacks on paramedics in # cambridgeshire on the rise-why ?
more here- # cmblive
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: fund raising continues for chris turner memorial
text: a total of £ 15,000 has already been raised to build a statue to remember former posh legend chris turner .
the campaign to find the further £ 60,000 to fund the planned artwork is being launched officially tonight .
the former peterborough and cambridge united player and manager died in april after suffering from a form of dementia .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: two arrests in wisbech
text: earlier we reported that fenland police had made two arrests in wisbech .
we can now confirm that a 45-year-old man from wisbech was arrested on warrant for failing to appear at court .
he has been detained .
a 26-year-old man has been arrested on sus of theft from a motor vehicle .
he 's still in custody at the police investigation centre .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: emil grondal to make peterborough return for 2016
text: peterborough panthers ' 2016 line-up is continuing to take shape .
young dane emil grondal first arrived at the showground in june and impressed as panthers reached the premier league play-off semi-finals .
grondal now joins ulrich ostergaard , michael palm toft , nikolaj busk jakobsen and tom perry on peterborough 's rider roster for 2016 .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: call centres closed due to staff sickness
text: i 've found out staff sickness is affecting two call centres in the huntingdon area .
the ramsey office is closed today and yaxley will be closed tomorrow .
both teams deal with issues to do with housing and council tax , payments and planning .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spitfire pilot laid to rest
text: the final remains of a spitfire pilot who died when his plane crashed 75 years ago are being laid to rest .
a fragment of bone belonging to raf pilot officer harold penketh was discovered when the aircraft was excavated in cambridgeshire in october .
the rest of his body had been recovered shortly after the spitfire crashed during a training exercise in 1940 .
the remains have been cremated at woodvale crematorium in brighton and the ashes interred later in hove .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man and boy charged with huntingdon offences
text: a man and a boy from huntingdon have been charged with committing a number of offences in the town .

the 15-year-old boy has been charged with two firearms offences relating to a taser weapon , causing actual bodily harm , three counts of witness intimidation and breach of a criminal behaviour order .
the 25-year-old man has been charged with perverting the course of justice .
both were remanded into custody with the teenagers trial due to start in february .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: changes to driving test working hours `` compromising road safety ''
text: a driving test examiner has told me changing their working hours is `` compromising road safety for all concerned , including candidates and ourselves '' .
steve from peterborough is a member of the public and commercial services union and is taking action over proposals to work longer hours .
further action is expected tomorrow .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : still mild for this time of year
text: it 'll be a dry and fairly settled day with some bright or sunny spells .
maximum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: junior doctors in cambridgeshire vote for strike action
text: a junior doctor based at addenbrooke 's hospital says he voted in favour of taking industrial action `` unfortunately with a heavy heart '' .
some 98 % voted in favour of a full strike and 99 % in favour of action just short of a full strike .
yezen sheena said : `` we all work long hours and do so willingly , and none of us came into this career to be workshy .
we all love treating and caring for patients , but the changes to our contract are dangerous . ''

documents.title: shoplifting is being taken seriously , say cambridgeshire police
text: cambridgeshire police have told us they take shoplifting seriously and `` would always encourage retailers to notify police of incidents '' .
it comes after calls have been made by neil mackay the owner of mackays hardware store in cambridge , to 'ban ' the word 'shoplifting ' and use 'shoptheft ' instead .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more funding needed in cambridgeshire schools
text: the mp for south east cambridgeshire , lucy frazer , says it 's not fair schools in cambridgeshire get the lowest funding in england - £ 600 per pupil less than the english average .
it comes after a bbc investigation found there 's a serious shortage of places for teachers across the county .

documents.title: teacher shortages felt across cambridgeshire
text: cambridgeshire headteachers have expressed growing concerns recruiting secondary school teachers in certain subjects is virtually impossible .

new figures obtained by the bbc show that this calendar year secondary schools in cambridgeshire and peterborough have advertised over 300 vacancies where some have n't received a single application .

andrew goulding , the head at hinchingbrooke school , said they 're experiencing some shortages and it has `` a profound effect '' on them and they have to `` spend a fortune every year advertising '' .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: 'anger ' at driving test cancellations in cambridgeshire
text: as we 've been reporting this morning , driving tests across cambridgeshire are being disrupted due to strike action from members of the public and commercial services union .
andy knight told me the fact he ca n't take his motorbike test days has cost him a lot of money .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: robertson new sligo boss
text: former peterborough united manager dave robertson has just been named as boss of league of ireland side sligo rovers .
robertson was sacked by posh in september after winning just one of their first six league games this season .
i am delighted to be coming to work at sligo rovers .
it is a big club with big expectations , '' he said .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: early morning arrests in wisbech
text: this tweet has just been sent out by fenland police .
we 're trying to get more information and as soon as we have it we 'll share it with you .
early morning arrests in wisbech town and rural areas have resulted in 2 wanted persons in custody at the pic .

documents.title: headlines : driving test cancellations cause 'confusion ' campaign launched to get a statue made to remember sporting legend
text: here are the headlines this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: disruption to driving tests in cambridgeshire
text: frustration is being felt in peterborough this morning as people have been turning up for their driving and motor cycle tests to find out they 've been cancelled .
at the moment members of the public and commercial services union at the fengate site are striking as they believe proposals to work longer working hours would compromise road safety .
they 're planning to strike again tomorrow .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: thousands of pounds needed to erect statue for peterborough legend
text: a campaign is being launched tonight to fund a statue to honour the former player and manager of peterborough united , chris turner .
fans of the posh hope to raise £ 75,000 to erect the statue outside the london road ground .
turner , who also played and managed cambridge united , died in april aged 64 after being diagnosed with dementia in 2006 .
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: 'ban ' the word 'shoplifting ' says business owner
text: the owner of mackays hardware store in cambridge has started a campaign to get the word shoplifting 'banned ' .
neil mackay says he wants the word `` shoptheft '' to be used instead as the theft of anything worth under £ 200 is now classed by some as a `` misdemeanor '' .
he believes it needs to be seen as a `` criminal act '' and too many people `` treat it as if it 's been demeaned or lowered '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: strike may cause driving tests to be cancelled
text: a two day strike by members of the public and commercial services union could result in learner drivers due to take their test may only find out if it is going ahead when they turn up .
martin tyler , from jp school of motoring in cambridge , says the `` uncertainty '' wo n't help anyone as he has several tests booked in today .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: driving tests cancelled in cambridgeshire due to strike
text: driving tests in cambridgeshire are being cancelled today as members of the public and commercial services union strike today over planned changes to working conditions and a proposed extension to their working day .
i 'm at the peterborough driving test centre in fengate where i 've been told between six and eight examiners normally work - today there are just three , with the same number on strike .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: teacher shortages felt across cambridgeshire
text: new figures obtained by the bbc show secondary schools in cambridgeshire and peterborough have advertised for 303 jobs this year , mostly in maths and science .
last year , the eastern region advertised the most teaching jobs outside london .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: weather : dry with some bright or sunny spells .
text: it 'll be a dry and fairly settled day with some bright or sunny spells .
it will stay breezy , but will still be mild for the time of year..
maximum temperature 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : crash closes a47 in wansford
text: the a47 in wansford is closed , and there are delays and queuing traffic in both directions near the a1 great north road junction because of an accident .
a diversion is in place .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : teaching staff shortage in cambridgeshire business owner calls for ban on using the word 'shoplifting '
text: here are this morning 's news headlines :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : cancellations to some train services in cambridgeshire
text: there are cancellations and alterations on greater anglia trains this morning .
the train operator says most ipswich to peterborough services will be cancelled .
cancellations & alterations for norwich to great yarmouth & ipswich to peterborough , today until sunday 22nd rh

documents.title: good morning from the cambridgeshire live team
text: good morning and welcome to today 's cambridgeshire live page .
the team will be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the county .
you can send us your stories ,
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live
